channel.title: [Solved] [PI] Object offset and distance not working properly
channel.description:
Nevermind. Figured out the issue..
For those who may later have this issue:
objectDistance = the distance between you and the object.
I'd change it based on the printout of: [code=java]System.out.println("objDist:"+ (((c.getX() > c.objectX) ? c.getX() - c.objectX : c.objectX - c.getX()) + ((c.getY() > c.objectY) ? c.getY() - c.objectY : c.objectY - c.getY()));[/code] These 2 I wouldn't use, but this is essentially what they're used for. objectXOffset = adding amount to objects X pos. objectYOffset = adding amount to objects Y pos.

item.title: [Solved] [PI] Object offset and distance not working properly

item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:1, topic:545304”]Nevermind. Figured out the issue…

For those who may later have this issue:

objectDistance = the distance between you and the object.

I’d change it based on the printout of:

These 2 I wouldn’t use, but this is essentially what they’re used for.
objectXOffset = adding amount to objects X pos.
objectYOffset = adding amount to objects Y pos.[/quote]

use Math.abs gives you a positive value of the difference
